metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2633 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds memory access issue was found in Quick Emulator (QEMU) before 1.7.2 in the VNC display driver. This flaw could occur while refreshing the VNC display surface area in the 'vnc_refresh_server_surface'. A user inside a guest could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-kvm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-common - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-user - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-user-static - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
qemu-utils - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.10').
